page.title: 13New Mill Co-op.
page.content: New Mill Co-op is the villages largest shop.It was established in 1885 as part of the Wooldale Society. The shop manager is Robert Nuttall and he supervises a staff of 1 full-time and 5 part-time assistants.The shop opens daily except Sunday.Saturday is a half day and Thursday and Friday there is late night opening.The Co-op is principally a food store but does have a non-food section which supplies goods ranging from cans of paint to socks and handkerchieves.Customers serve themselves from the shelves with tinned and packet foods and choose their own fruit and vegetables for weighing.Meat and dairy produce is served by an assistant.There are two well stocked freezers providing further choice.Wines,beers and spirits can also be bought.Fresh bread and milk is delivered daily.
